segments.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, mahāsamudde udakaṃ parikkhayaṃ pariyādānaṃ gaccheyya ṭhapetvā dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni.
segments.en: “Mendicants, suppose the water in the ocean dried up and evaporated except for two or three drops.

segments.pli: katamaṃ nu kho bahutaraṃ—yaṃ vā mahāsamudde udakaṃ parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādinnaṃ, yāni dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni avasiṭṭhānī”ti?
segments.en: Which is more: the water in the ocean that has dried up and evaporated, or the two or three drops left?”

segments.pli: “Etadeva, bhante, bahutaraṃ mahāsamudde udakaṃ yadidaṃ parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādinnaṃ; appamattakāni dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni avasiṭṭhāni.
segments.en: “Sir, the water in the ocean that has dried up and evaporated is certainly more. The two or three drops left are tiny.

segments.pli: Saṅkhampi na upenti, upanidhampi na upenti, kalabhāgampi na upenti mahāsamudde udakaṃ parikkhīṇaṃ pariyādinnaṃ upanidhāya dve vā tīṇi vā udakaphusitāni avasiṭṭhānī”ti.
segments.en: Compared to the water in the ocean that has dried up and evaporated, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
“In the same way, for a noble disciple …
That’s why you should practice meditation …”

sections.title: “Mendicants, suppose the water in the ocean dried up…

suttaplex.blurb: As a few drops of water compared to the ocean, so is the suffering remaining to one who has seen the four noble truths.
